page.title: 08Clifton Farm.Hemingford Grey
page.content: The Clifton farm is situated approximately one mile south west of St. Ives, in the village of Hemingford Grey. It comprises 24 hectares of well drained soil growing mainly vegetables. The owner has lived in the village for 44 years. During that time he has seen many changes in his farm and in farming locally. He has had the farm for the last 24 years, the first 14 of which he kept pigs. He has seen farming change from mainly manual work and the use of horses to today's use of tractors and highly specialised machinery. This farm is not typical of farms in this area. Most local farms are arable, growing mainly cereal crops with some dairying. The fields tend to be very large leading to typical flat, open East Anglian landscapes.
